A Product_specification is a type of that characterizes a product or a set of products in a by a set of specifications. A Product_specification identifies a manufacturable object, or expected as so.

The kind of product that is to be manufactured from the data of the Product_specification, is the kind of product that the item_context attribute identifies a class of.
The intent of the Product_specification entity is the identification of one manufacturable object whereas the intent of is the gathering of products with similar characteristics.
The actual set of instances for a Product_specification are obtained by the union of the Specification instances grouped in the defining_specification attribute and of the Specification instances related to the considered through a or a with association_type 'identification' or 'non replaceable standard'.
The specification of a Product_specification may be incomplete: there may not be in 'defining_specifications' any instance of for some declared as mandatory for the considered . For these instances, any specification available in the context of the considered is considered as valid for the manufacturing of the product characterized by the considered Product_specification.
If the colour is not specified for a given product family, the specified product resulting from the realization of a Product_specification associated to the representing the product family may be without paint or painted in any available colour.

A Specification_based_product_version is a type of that is defined by a Product_specification. The entity Specification_based_product_version may be instantiated jointly with other subtypes of .
Depending on the specialization of , a Specification_based_product_version may identify a part version that provides the design of a manufactured product, a document version that is a realization of a document product or a function version.
The Product_specification provides the set of specifications from which the product version shall be designed or manufactured.
A brochure editor may offer to his customers various brochure types with variable paper quality, coloring, layout. These concepts can be represented with instances of the entities defined in the product_class module. Thus, an instance of Specification_based_product_version may identify a document version that is the realization of a particular kind of brochure with a particular selection of paper and layout.
